# replacementIndex

**Type Property**

The replacement position associated with a format string specifier.

## Declaration

```swift
static let replacementIndex: NSAttributedString.Key
```

## Discussion

When creating an attributed string from a format string and one or more replacement values, this attribute indicates the ordinal index of each replacement. You must specify the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSAttributedStringFormattingOptions/NSAttributedStringFormattingApplyReplacementIndexAttribute] option at creation time to add this attribute to the substituted text. The value of this key is an `NSNumber` with the replacement position of the substitute text.

- **cursor**: The cursor object.
- **link**: The link for the text.
- **markedClauseSegment**: The index of the marked clause segment.
- **shadow**: The shadow of the text.
- **spellingState**: The spelling state of the text.
- **suggestionHighlight**: A highlight associated with a Spotlight suggestion.
- **textAlternatives**: The alternatives for the text.
- **textEffect**: An attribute that applies a text effect to the text.
- **textHighlightColorScheme**: The custom highlight color to apply to the text.
- **textHighlightStyle**: An attribute that adds a highlight color to the text to emphasize it.
- **textItemTag**: The name of a custom tag associated with a text item.
- **toolTip**: The tooltip text.
